title: A Happy Valentine's Day Photo from Prince William and Princess Catherine
summary: Prince William and Princess Catherine shared a new photo for Valentine's Day. The picture is black and white and was taken in Norfolk last year by a photographer named Josh Shinner. They posted it on social media with a heart emoji and a message saying 'Happy Valentine's Day.' This is the second year they have done this. Last year, they shared a photo from a video when Princess Catherine finished her cancer treatment. The new photo shows them smiling together. They also released a Christmas card with their family, including their three children, taken by the same photographer. The article talks about how Princess Catherine is slowly returning to public life after her illness.

websites and apps where people share things online

questions.question: Who shared the Valentine's Day photo?
What color is the new photo?
What did Princess Catherine finish last year?
What was on the Christmas card?

background_read: Valentine's Day is celebrated on February 14th as a day for love and affection. Royal families often share photos to connect with people. Cancer treatment involves medical care to fight illness, and recovery can take time. Social media helps share news quickly.
Article_Structure: WHO: Prince William and Princess Catherine
WHAT: They released a Valentine's Day photo and a Christmas card
WHERE: The photo was taken in Norfolk, England
WHY: To mark Valentine's Day and show Princess Catherine's return to public life after cancer treatment

perspectives.description: The article shows how the royal couple uses photos to share happy times with the public.
